bug.short_desc: Harden all packages: traceroute executables should use PIE and have RELRO enabled

long_desc.thetext:
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): traceroute-2.1.0-1.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: always, this is caused by the build flags
Steps to reproduce: $ checksec --file /usr/bin/traceroute RELRO STACK CANARY NX PIE RPATH RUNPATH FILE Partial RELRO Canary found NX enabled No PIE No RPATH No RUNPATH /usr/bin/traceroute
Actual results: traceroute is not hardened
Expected results: traceroute should be hardened
Additional info: https://fedoraproject.org//wiki/Changes/Harden_All_Packages
traceroute-2.1.0-2.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-3fba0b6c95
traceroute-2.1.0-2.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1aac964aa9

traceroute-2.1.0-2.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-3fba0b6c95

traceroute-2.1.0-2.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1aac964aa9
traceroute-2.1.0-2.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
traceroute-2.1.0-2.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
